acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50=864mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50 value: 6.35ml/k (reduced value = 5144mg/kg), and >5000mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified based on rat LC50 (6 hours) value: 6377ppm (4-hour equivalent: 27.46mg/kg) (PATTY 4th, 1994). Such concentration could be judged to be steam with almost no mist from its vapor pressure, and it was classified as Category 5 by the ppm concentration standards.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Rat LD50 value: 4585mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994), 3200mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 4100mg/kg and 2572mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994). Calculated based on the data above. Since the calculated values was 2875mg/kg, it was classified to category 5.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Category 2 because of a ketone composed of 13 carbon atoms or less.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =60800mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: <23degC, Initial boiling point: >35degC, UNRTDG Class: 3, PG II

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2B based on the description hat slight damaging property was acknowledged in the test applied to the eyes of the rabbits and it recovered within seven days (PATTY (4th, 1994)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There was no animal test data in application of less than 4 hours. But it was set as Category 2 from description that the moderate irritation was admitted in the test applied to the skin of rabbit and guinea pig for 24 hours (PATTY (4th, 1994)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description that skin sensitization was not acknowledged with the guinea pigs in PATTY (4th, 1994), and description that skin sensitization was not acknowledged by the test for human, it may have been Out Of Category, however, the test method was unknown for the test of the guinea pigs, and since test subjects for human was the small-scale test of 25 examples, we thought the data is too insufficient to classify it to be Out Of Category, and we could not classify it.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Narcotic effects, Respiratory tract irritation
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Because of a description in PATTY (4th, 1994) referring to confirmation of temporary central nervous system depressions in an inhalation exposure test using rats, and of a description referring to that it was used in order to measure relative susceptibility of human lungs to irritant gas. So it was judged that there were anesthetic actions and respiratory irritant, and determined to be Category 3 (anesthetic actions, respiratory irritant).
